intro: Hieracium magyaricum subsp. nematomastix, commonly known as the Hungarian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
